Regulating in the Trump Era: The Case of the FDA

With its broad regulatory power over the food we eat and the medicines we take, the FDA has become a case study in the Trump administration’s approach to regulation – and deregulation: how will the agency speed new medicines and technologies to market while ensuring public safety?
With drug costs a top concern for voters of both parties, how will the FDA deliver on the president’s campaign promises to reduce drug prices?
And what will be the fate of signature Obama-era food policies such as revamped nutrition labeling and stepped up food safety oversight?
What is FDA’s role in tackling major public health problems, like obesity and opioid abuse?
